Requesting the character of Wheelie, going back along with Leos' crew to pa=
storal Earth.  Can be one of the reinforcements and such sent in.

WHEELIE
=

Faction: Autobot/Maximal

QUOTE:  Look there, over there!  Friends find, l=
ook behind!

PROFILE:  An Autobot by the name of Wheelie grew up on a crash=
ed ship, surviving for an unkonwn period of time on Quintessa.  Found by Au=
tobots during the first Unicron crisis, he soon joined them and was a stalw=
art part of their forces going alon gwith the first Maximal Imperium after =
the war.  A loner often forming strong bonds adn freindships and with a uni=
que sort of personality from his time spent in isolation and having to figh=
t to survive, Wheelie is often accompanied by his scrounger friend Gnaw, op=
erating with local groups that cna tolerate his infmay as he moves on.

ABI=
LITIES:  A permanent glitch in his vocal processor developed by his long pe=
riod in isolation upon Quintessa, Wheelie's vocalizer tends to vocalize in =
ways in whatever linguistic dialect that are often translated as 'rhymes'. =
 These tend to be high pitched, grating, and annoying, and prolonged exposu=
re is held to be extremely damaging to one's circuits, much like Cosmic Rus=
t and Fire Suppressant Foam.  As such, the sight (or sound) of Wheelie on t=
he battlefield is often enough to drive many Predacons or Decepticons to fl=
ee and abandon the area.

Wheelie is armed with a small energon slingshot w=
ith a close range high capacity load that is capable of inflicting signific=
ant damage on larger Cybertronians.  His small alt mode of a Cybertronian r=
acer has a top speed of 180 kilometers per hour and a range of over three t=
housand kilometers.  Wheelie himself is heavily energon efficient, even by =
Maximal standard, and his bodyframe is capable of extended independent func=
tioning without refueling or repairs (which is the way many Maximals would =
profess to like it), and is quite simplistic to maintain that even Wheelie =
can keep himself basically functional without medical supervision.  His sma=
ll bodyframe is also quite agile and difficult to hit, combined with his lo=
ng vorns spent of surviving have made him quite surprisingly adept at escap=
e and evasion, guerilla operations, and reconaissance in urban or organic a=
reas.


Weaknesses:  Wheelie has much of a reputation, deserved or not, amo=
ng Autobots and Decepticons.  While he can count some as staunch friends, h=
is ability to seemingly inflict insanity to those in constant presence of h=
is chattering has made many Autobots and Maximals wish to avoid prolonged i=
nteractions with him, and can lead to his constant solo operations in the f=
ield without backup.  This has also lead to a constant but unsubstantiated =
threats of violence to be inflicted upon him by his own faction, depending =
on how casual the company is.

Wheelie's form, while agile, is very small a=
nd very vulnerable, and lacks power.  He is weak physically, and his primar=
y weapon (an energon slingshot) has a very limited range, and even low powe=
red energy weapons can inflict significant damage upon him.  In a hand to h=
and fight he is seriously vulnerable to damage and can take few hits.


His=
tory:  Wheelie spent unknown thousands of vorns as the only survivor of a c=
rashed ship upon Quintessa, where upon his rescue he became a stalwart part=
 of the AUtobot forces, most often operating on long range reconaissance mi=
ssions or as backup to his friends.  After the Autobot/Decepticon War ended=
, and many of his friends went into retirement, Wheelie was not upgraded al=
ong with teh initial wave of Maximal upgrading, preferring to keep his orig=
inal body as a memory to those whom had been lost in the war.

Pending the =
end of the war, Wheelie's whereabouts became much fo a mystery, with variou=
s stories at any point theorizing he had been killed in a back alley by Aut=
obot/Decepticons (most often accompanied by 'I'LL DRINK TO THAT!' in Maccad=
am's) to that he was working with th Maximal Security Administration.  One =
theroy even stated that he had been part of the Maximal Experimentation Pro=
gram that had produced Protoform X, simply stating that he was what had dri=
ven the unit that would eventually call itself Rampage to total sociopathy =
and nihilism simply from being locked in a cell for the experiments!  Many =
would explain their decline to believe in Primus by saying 'He made that gu=
y, didn't he?' and gesture to the MiniBot.

(Un)fortunately, Wheelie has be=
en still functioning over the era, living on Cybertron, often going on trip=
s to search the galaxy and find more information.  While there, he would sp=
end much of his time in Little Iacon remiscing of the old days.  Upon attem=
ptimg to join a craft, according to scuttleaft a Maximal hit upon the idea =
of sending him along with Leo's reinforcement crew to Earth.

Further scutt=
leaft was hoping that by sending him several tens of thousands of vorns bac=
k in time and to active military conflict would 'get the little cans to be =
recycled', but were never actively confirmed as transfer orders were sent.
=
